content.text:
The issue is on line 108 — `resolvedTheme`'s initial state calls `getSystemTheme()` which accesses `window` unconditionally. The `getTheme` function on line 32 already guards against SSR, but `getSystemTheme` doesn't.

Fix: add a `typeof window === "undefined"` guard in `getSystemTheme`.

content.content: The file /Users/jw/Desktop/repos/laxdb/packages/ui/src/components/theme-provider.tsx has been updated successfully.

content.text: Done. Added a `typeof window === "undefined"` guard to `getSystemTheme` so it returns `"light"` during SSR instead of crashing. The client-side `useEffect` on line 162 will pick up the real system theme after hydration.

content.thinking:
Let me re-read the file to understand the current state and the issue better. The user is saying that "system" is always selected - meaning the theme is always stuck on "system" and never resolves properly. Let me look at the component again.

The issue is that during SSR, `getTheme` returns the fallback (which is `defaultTheme = "system"`) because `typeof window === "undefined"`. Then on the client, `useState` doesn't re-run its initializer, so it stays as "system".

Wait, actually `getTheme` already handles SSR correctly by returning the fallback. The real problem the user is describing now is probably different - let me re-read.


The problem is likely a hydration mismatch - on the server, `getTheme` returns "system" as the fallback, but on the client it should read from localStorage and return the actual stored value, causing React to see different values during hydration. returns "system" (the fallback). Then during hydration on the client, React reuses the server value and doesn't re-run the initializer.

The standard fix for this is to use `useEffect` to sync from localStorage after mount. Let me check the current implementation.

Looking at line 106: `const [theme, setThemeState] = useState<Theme>(() => getTheme(storageKey, defaultTheme) as Theme);`

During SSR, `getTheme` returns `defaultTheme` ("system") since `typeof window === "undefined"`. On the client, React reuses that server value without re-running the initializer, so `theme` stays stuck at "system" and never pulls the actual value from localStorage.

I need to add a `useEffect` that runs on mount to read from localStorage and update the state accordingly.

content.text:
The problem: during SSR, `useState` initializer on line 109 calls `getTheme` which returns the fallback `"system"` (since no `window`). During hydration React reuses that server value and never re-runs the initializer — so `theme` is stuck on `"system"`.

Fix: add a `useEffect` to hydrate the real theme from `localStorage` on mount.

content.thinking:
I see there are two distinct changes:
1. SSR guard for `getSystemTheme` (and a small fix to `getTheme` returning `fallback` instead of `undefined`)
2. Hydration useEffect to sync theme from localStorage on mount

I also notice the diff shows `getTheme` changed from `return;` to `return fallback;` - but looking at the original file I read, it already had `return fallback;` on line 36. The diff might be showing a difference from the git HEAD. Let me make two atomic commits.

I need to be careful about how to split these. Let me use `git add -p` approach, but the instructions say not to use `-i` flag. 

Actually, `git add -p` is patch mode, which is different from the `-i` flag restriction—that's specifically for interactive rebase and interactive add. So I can use patch mode to stage the changes in separate hunks and commit them atomically.

Wait, but patch mode is still interactive in nature. Let me think of a cleaner approach: I could manually split the work by copying the file, reverting to the original state, applying just the first change and committing, then applying the second change. Or since there are only two distinct logical changes in this one file—the SSR guard fix and the fallback return value—I could commit them together or find another way to separate them cleanly.

Actually, the simplest solution is to just undo one change, commit the first fix, then re-apply and commit the second. That way I get two separate, well-described commits without needing interactive tools.

content.text: Two logical fixes — I'll split them into atomic commits. First, I'll temporarily revert the hydration fix, commit the SSR guard, then add the hydration fix.

content.content: The file /Users/jw/Desktop/repos/laxdb/packages/ui/src/components/theme-provider.tsx has been updated successfully.

lines: +  // Hydrate theme from localStorage on mount (SSR renders with fallback)
+    const stored = getTheme(storageKey, defaultTheme) as Theme;

input.command:
git add packages/ui/src/components/theme-provider.tsx && git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
fix(ui): hydrate theme from localStorage after SSR

useState initializers don't re-run during hydration, so the theme
was stuck on the SSR fallback ("system"). Sync from localStorage
on mount to pick up the user's actual preference.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"

content.text: Lint caught a missing dependency — `theme` needs to be in the `useEffect` deps. Let me fix that.

content.thinking:
The linter is complaining that `theme` is used in the effect but not in the dependency array. However, I actually don't want this to re-run when `theme` changes — it's only meant to run once on mount to hydrate from localStorage. Adding `theme` to the deps would cause unnecessary re-runs.

The simplest fix: read theme from the ref or use a different approach. Actually, the simplest approach is to not reference `theme` in the effect at all — just always set from localStorage unconditionally, and let React bail out if the value is the same (since `useState` already does this with same-value checks).

Let me just remove the `if (stored !== theme)` guard and always call `setThemeState(stored)`. React's useState setter already skips re-renders when the value is the same via Object.is comparison.

content.text: The linter wants `theme` in the deps, but we only want this to run on mount. Simplest fix: remove the conditional — React's `useState` setter already bails out on same values.

content.content: The file /Users/jw/Desktop/repos/laxdb/packages/ui/src/components/theme-provider.tsx has been updated successfully.

lines: // Hydrate theme from localStorage on mount (SSR renders with fallback)
-    const stored = getTheme(storageKey, defaultTheme) as Theme;

input.command:
git add packages/ui/src/components/theme-provider.tsx && git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
fix(ui): hydrate theme from localStorage after SSR

useState initializers don't re-run during hydration, so the theme
was stuck on the SSR fallback ("system"). Sync from localStorage
on mount to pick up the user's actual preference.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"

content.text:
Two atomic commits, both passing lint + typecheck:

1. **`2a69d1a`** — `fix(ui): guard getSystemTheme against SSR window access` — adds `typeof window` guard so SSR doesn't crash
2. **`e0f0582`** — `fix(ui): hydrate theme from localStorage after SSR` — syncs theme from `localStorage` on mount so it's not stuck on "system"
